I've purchased a home and furnished it. Can I adopt a child now?
Sorry, I can't afford it right now.
I... hadn't thought of that. I own a house, but I don't have a room for them.
Sure. When I don't need him, he can stay with you.
You can find, make, or buy a variety of gifts for your children, including toys, clothing, and sweets.
Where can I learn more about magic?
I'm a bit short of money right now. (<Global=BYOHHPCost> gold)
No. Now get it out of here.
Give me everything you're carrying, dog.
It's time for us to move.
I got your letter about the land for sale. Is it still available?
My house in Markarth would be perfect.
Do you have any work you need done?
Speak to the Jarl of Falkreath
Is that land you mentioned still available?
I'd like to purchase a house.
If you would like to adopt an orphan from the Orphanage, speak to Constance Michel.
All right. But you're responsible for him.
I'll have to think about it.
Your old place would suit us just fine.
Here's your money. She'd better be safe. (Give <Global=BYOHHBA2Ransom> gold)
Cut it out, both of you.
I don't have the money. Can't you just let him go?
I don't need your services any more.
Read the bandit's ransom note for <Alias=Spouse>
How about you just let her go and nobody has to get hurt? (Persuade)
What did you do to my husband?
What did you do to my wife?
I'd like to make a request.
I'd like you to play a different instrument.
I've changed my mind. I'd like you to stay.
I don't have the money. Can't you just let her go?
How about you just let him go and nobody has to get hurt? (Persuade)
Here's your money. He'd better be safe. (Give <Global=BYOHHBA2Ransom> gold)

Not yet. I'll be back for you.

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Player>,
As a mark of the high esteem in which you are held by Jarl <Alias=Jarl>, <Alias.Pronoun=Jarl> has instructed me to offer you an opportunity to become a landowner in <Alias=Hold>. A choice piece of undeveloped land in the hold has just become available. Please contact me if you are interested in purchasing it.
Your humble servant, etc., etc.,
<Alias=Steward>, Steward to Jarl <Alias=Jarl> of <Alias=HoldCity>
You awaken feeling a Father's Love.

WANTED ~ A Good Home ~

In these days of war and strife, the orphans of Skyrim are the true victims. Many have no one left to turn to, and face a life of hard labor, poverty, and misery. If you could provide a stable home for one of these innocent children, please, consider adoption. Whether you choose to adopt from us, or to take in someone closer to home, you can make a difference in a child's life. For more information, enquire with: Constance Michel Honorhall Orphanage, Riften

<font face='$HandwrittenFont' size='16'> <Alias=Player>,
After a careful review of the building plans for <Alias=Home>, your house in <Alias=HomeCity>, I can offer you an additional option for furnishing your home: if you wish, you can now purchase a children's bedroom set. I have arranged to update your Home Decorating Guide accordingly.
As always, please speak with me if you would like to purchase this or any other furnishings for your house.
Sincerely, <Alias=HomeCitySteward> Steward of <Alias=HomeCity> </font>

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Player>,
As a mark of the high esteem in which you are held by me and my people, I would like to offer you an opportunity to become a landowner in <Alias=Hold>. A choice piece of undeveloped land in the hold has just become available. Please contact me if you are interested in purchasing it.
I remain,
Jarl <Alias=Jarl> of <Alias=HoldCity>
Healing spells and potions restore <25>% more health for <8> hours.
Healing spells and potions restore <25>% more health for <8> hours.
You awaken feeling a Mother's Love.
There is already something growing here. What would you like to do?
Only one item at a time can be planted.

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Jarl>, Jarl of <Alias=HoldCity>, to <Alias=Player>, <Alias.PronounPosObj=Jarl> faithful friend; grant of the steading of Windstad Manor, near the Mouths of the Karth, north of Morthal.
Witnessed by <Alias=Steward>, Steward to Jarl <Alias=Jarl>, <Global.Day=GameDaysPassed> <Global.MonthWord=GameDaysPassed>, <Global.Year=GameDaysPassed>

[pagebreak]

The Beginner's Guide to Homesteading

[pagebreak]

If you're like most people, you've always dreamed of owning your own steading and building your own home. But where to start? Never fear, you hold in your hands the guide to everything you need to know. Before long, you'll be gazing complacently across your well-tended lands from the porch of your own manor house. [pagebreak] Getting Started There are two vital pieces of equipment that the prospective homeowner needs: the Drafting Table and the Carpenter's Workbench. Your Drafting Table is where you'll lay out the plans for each stage of your new house. Don't worry about making a mistake here - you can always change your mind, and making a new plan costs you nothing. Remember: measure twice and cut once. Your Carpenter's Workbench is where you'll do the actual construction. Once you've settled on a plan at the Drafting Table, you can start building your house at the Carpenter's Workbench. Avoid the common beginner's mistake - don't try to build the roof without building the proper supports first! Space for the Family If you have a spouse or children, you'll certainly want to get the house in a livable state as soon as possible. Your loving spouse will no doubt make do with nothing more than a roof over her head and a bed to sleep in, but what about the children? Don't worry - all they need is a bed and a chest or dresser to store their treasures, and they will be perfectly content. Building Materials You will need a lot of supplies to complete your house, but it isn't necessary to gather everything you need ahead of time. Unless you're in a hurry, you can just build in stages as materials become available. You'll enjoy watching your home progress from dream to reality. The most common materials you'll need are sawn logs, cut stone, and clay. Luckily, these are plentiful in Skyrim - in fact, most building sites will have one or more easily accessible sources of clay and stone. For sawn lumber, any lumber mill owner will be glad to sell and deliver as much as you need. You'll need a lot of nails - fortunately even a novice blacksmith will soon find themselves turning iron into nails with ease. When you turn to furnishing your completed house, you'll need a much wider variety of materials. Some of them, such as straw and glass, are commonly obtained from general goods stores. For the rest - the whole of Skyrim will become your general store! Hiring a Steward Once your estate is well-established, you may wish to consider hiring a steward to help manage your affairs. A good steward can be invaluable - from hiring a carriage driver to buying a cow to keeping you supplied with building materials - freeing you to enjoy the fruits of your labors. Before hiring a steward, it's advisable to bring a potential candidate to your manor and observe whether they are a good fit for your requirements. Remember, you are putting your entire estate into their hands - you need someone you can trust implicitly. Building Your House The rest of this guide will review plans for each room that you might want to build. [pagebreak] [pagebreak] Small House Before you get too ambitious, gain confidence by building this tidy cottage. It is the perfect starter home, and might turn out to be all you need. But don't worry - if you decide to keep building, you can remodel this into an entry way to the rest of your house. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] Main Hall You may decide the Small House is not enough - perhaps you need room for a growing family? The next step is to add a Main Hall, which will turn your cottage into an imposing manor house: two floors, including space for two small bedrooms, a back room and a large dining area. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] Additions Once you've built a Main Hall, your options become almost unlimited - you now have room to add three more additional wings, if you decide you still need more space. For each wing, you have three choices of what to build, giving a total of nine possible additions! (But remember - you can only build three of them, so choose wisely.) [pagebreak] West Wing - Bedrooms The Bedroom addition is perfect if you have a family who needs more comfortable living quarters than the Main Hall affords. The Bedroom has space for a master bedroom plus two children's beds, as well as all the dressers, wardrobes, etc. that anyone could desire. This addition also includes a spacious exterior porch. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] West Wing - Greenhouse Perhaps you are a gardener at heart? If so, the Greenhouse provides room for planters where you can grow almost whatever you wish, sheltered from Skyrim's harsh climate. Tend and harvest your crops from the comfort of your own home! [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] West Wing - Enchanter's Tower If your interests lie in the magical realm, this tower addition is for you. Conduct your research in privacy and comfort. Plenty of space for keeping your collections and artifacts organized. And the view from the tower is guaranteed to take your breath away. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] North Wing - Storage Room If you simply need more space to store your many possessions and collections, build yourself a Storage Room. The included porch can even be connected to the porch on the East or West wings, if you build the Bedroom or Armory additions. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] North Wing - Trophy Room Are you a big game hunter who wants to show off your prizes? The Trophy Room provides space for displaying up to seven magnificent mounted specimens of your choice, sure to amaze and impress your guests. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] North Wing - Alchemy Laboratory Perfect for the aspiring alchemist, this tower addition will give you plenty of space and storage to hone your craft in comfort. And when you need a break from brewing potions, enjoy the view from the tower roof. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] East Wing - Armory If you like nothing better than to spend a day hammering metal, or are simply a collector of armor and weapons, the Armory is for you. With space for smithing, as well as plenty of room to display your martial collections in style, the Armory is the perfect addition to any house. [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] East Wing - Kitchen The Kitchen provides everything you need to pursue the highest culinary arts. Tired of cooking everything in a pot over a fire? You can even equip it with a new-fangled oven! [pagebreak]

[pagebreak] East Wing - Library The Library tower is sure to please those who value literature. With space for all the bookshelves you could desire, you'll be able to enjoy your collection of books in style. Or perhaps take a book to the tower roof and enjoy the view of your steading? [pagebreak]

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Jarl>, Jarl of <Alias=HoldCity>, to <Alias=Player>, <Alias.PronounPosObj=Jarl> loyal friend; grant of the steading of Lakeview Manor on the south shore of Lake Ilinalta, east of Falkreath.
Witnessed by <Alias=Steward>, Steward to Jarl <Alias=Jarl>, <Global.Day=GameDaysPassed> <Global.MonthWord=GameDaysPassed>, <Global.Year=GameDaysPassed>

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Jarl>, Jarl of <Alias=HoldCity>, to <Alias=Player>, <Alias.PronounPosObj=Jarl> steadfast friend; grant of the steading of Heljarchen Hall, south of Fort Dunstad near Giants' Gap.
Granted on <Global.Day=GameDaysPassed> <Global.MonthWord=GameDaysPassed>, <Global.Year=GameDaysPassed>

<font face="$HandwrittenFont" size="18"> <Alias=Player>,
Allow me to introduce myself. My name is <Alias=Jarl>, and I have the honor to be the Jarl of the proud and ancient city of <Alias=HoldCity>.
The fame of your exploits across Skyrim has brought you to my attention. If you are interested in becoming a Thane of <Alias=Hold> hold, I invite you to speak to me the next time you are in <Alias=HoldCity>. Aside from the honor that accrues to the title, my thanes are entitled to a personal housecarl. I also can tell you privately that a choice parcel of land in <Alias=Hold> would be available for your purchase should your services prove useful to me.
I look forward to meeting you in person.
I remain,
Jarl <Alias=Jarl> of <Alias=HoldCity>

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'> While you were away, we came to visit your lovely new house. <Alias=Spouse> made us feel right at home. In fact, we liked <Alias.PronounObj=Spouse> so much we took <Alias.PronounObj=Spouse> back to <Alias=BanditDungeon> with us.
If you want <Alias=Spouse> back, come see me. Bring <Global=BYOHHBA2Ransom> gold and I'll discuss letting <Alias.PronounObj=Spouse> go.
Rochelle the Red
</font>
You only need to add one of each item to the hatchery.
You awaken feeling a surge of Vampiric power.

[pagebreak]

R I F T E N Home Decorating Guide

[pagebreak]

Welcome to your new home! This decorating guide provides a list of packages that you can purchase from the Steward of the hold. Each package contains furnishings and decor for a specific part of your house, and these will be delivered and placed for you upon purchase. All you need to do is provide the gold, and the Steward will take care of the rest. The next time that you visit your home after making your purchases, you will see your new decorations and furnishings in place. Kitchen This package will provide furnishings and decor for your kitchen, which is the room immediately beyond your home's front door. This includes the lighting of the fire. Bedroom Adds bedside tables, a dresser and a small table with two chairs to the master bedroom. This also includes an upgrade to the bed itself. Alchemy Laboratory This package will place an alchemy crafting table in your basement, along with some shelves and other decor. Enchanting Laboratory This package will place an item enchanting table in your basement, along with some shelves and other decor. Also includes a few practice dummies to test your new enchantments on. Children's Bedroom Adds a comfortable child's bedroom to your cellar, including two beds, a wardrobe, dresser, play area, and wall hangings. If you have previously purchased the Enchanting Laboratory, these furnishings will replace it (and vice-versa). Garden When you purchase this package, the small patch of land adjacent to your house will be planted with a wide range of herbs, vegetables and other plants native to Skyrim.

[pagebreak]

W H I T E R U N Home Decorating Guide

[pagebreak]

Welcome to your new home! This decorating guide provides a list of packages that you can purchase from the Steward of the hold. Each package contains furnishings and decor for a specific part of your house, and these will be delivered and placed for you upon purchase. All you need to do is provide the gold, and the Steward will take care of the rest. The next time that you visit your home after making your purchases, you will see your new decorations and furnishings in place. Kitchen Includes a fire pit, a small table and two chairs, as well as a shelf to store cooking supplies. Living Room Provides Wall-mounted shelves, a few side tables and two chairs placed near the fire pit, all near the center of the ground floor. Dining Room Adds a long wooden table and bench, as well as several shelves loaded with cutlery, dishes and cookware. Alchemy Laboratory This package adds an alchemy crafting station, a reading table and chair, and a large wardrobe to the rear area of the ground floor. This also includes the addition of a wall to divide the laboratory from the dining room. Children's Bedroom Instead of an Alchemy Laboratory, you can choose to furnish the room in the rear of your home with a cozy child's bedroom, including two beds, chests, and wall hangings. Note that this package will replace the Alchemy Laboratory if you have already purchased it (and vice-versa). Loft This package includes a few chairs and tables to fill out the upper-level loft. Bedroom Adds two bedside tables, a dresser and a small table with two chairs to the master bedroom. This also includes the addition of a wall to give the bedroom added privacy.

[pagebreak]

M A R K A R T H Home Decorating Guide

[pagebreak]

Welcome to your new home! This decorating guide provides a list of packages that you can purchase from the Steward of the hold. Each package contains furnishings and decor for a specific part of your house, and these will be delivered and placed for you upon purchase. All you need to do is provide the gold, and the Steward will take care of the rest. The next time that you visit your home after making your purchases, you will see your new decorations and furnishings in place. Entrance Hall When you purchase this package, floor mats and decorative planters will be added to the hallway just beyond the front door. Living Room This package fills out the home's large, central room with a large dining table, several smaller tables, shelves, a display case and other decor. Sleeping Quarters In addition to improved furnishings and decor for your master bedroom, this package also adds a small dining area between the guest and master bedroom, near the rear of the house. Alchemy Laboratory This package will furnish one the small rooms that adjoin the living room with the implements of an alchemist's laboratory. This includes an alchemy table, several shelves and added decor. Children's Bedroom This package supplies your home with everything needed for up to two children, including beds, a wardrobe, dresser, and other furnishings. Note that this package will replace your Alchemy Laboratory, and vice-versa. Enchanting Laboratory This package adds furniture and decor for a small enchanting laboratory adjoining the living room. This includes an enchanting table, shelves and decor.

[pagebreak]

S O L I T U D E Home Decorating Guide

[pagebreak]

Welcome to your new home! This decorating guide provides a list of packages that you can purchase from the Steward of the hold. Each package contains furnishings and decor for a specific part of your house, and these will be delivered and placed for you upon purchase. All you need to do is provide the gold, and the Steward will take care of the rest. The next time that you visit your home after making your purchases, you will see your new decorations and furnishings in place. Living Room This package adds a large table, chairs and a wide range of decor to the living area located centrally on the second floor of the house. Sleeping Quarters When you purchase this package, the master bedroom on the second floor of the house will be decorated with several furnishings and a larger, more luxurious bed. Also, a small dining area will be added just outside the bedroom door that includes a table, chairs and other decorations. Children's Bedroom This package provides elegant and comfortable accommodations for up to two children, including fine beds, a wardrobe, personal chests, and other decor. The purchase price includes the cost of new construction: this room will be added to the second floor of your home, next to your master bedroom. Alchemy Laboratory Fills out one of the ground floor rooms with implements and tools for an alchemy laboratory, including an alchemist's crafting table and related decor. Enchanting Laboratory Will stock one of the home's small ground-floor rooms with all of the furnishings for an enchanting laboratory, including an enchanter's crafting table. Also includes several practice dummies on which you can test out your new enchantments. Patio Places a small table, two chairs and other furnishings on the stone patio outside the back of the house.

[pagebreak]

W I N D H E L M Home Decorating Guide

[pagebreak]

Welcome to your new home! This decorating guide provides a list of packages that you can purchase from the Steward of the hold. Each package contains furnishings and decor for a specific part of your house, and these will be delivered and placed for you upon purchase. All you need to do is provide the gold, and the Steward will take care of the rest. The next time that you visit your home after making your purchases, you will see your new decorations and furnishings in place. Kitchen Includes a fireplace, a table for two and ample shelving to store your food and cooking supplies. Living Room This package fills Hjerim's spacious ground floor living room with several tables, chairs and shelves. Decorations for the floor and walls are also included. Alchemy Laboratory Adds an alchemy crafting station. Enchanting Laboratory Adds an enchanting crafting station. Upstairs Landing This package adds several weapon racks and display cases, and lines the walls with mounted animal heads. Bedroom Provides an upgrade to your bed, as well as shelving, display cases, improved lighting and other bedroom furnishings and decor. Guest Room Improves the furnishings and decor in your home's guest bedroom, including a finer-quality bed, a small table, and some shelves. Children's Bedroom Expands the corner room in the rear of the first floor of your house, converting it into a bedroom suitable for up to two children, including beds, a chest, dresser, and other decor.
Ah, I see. Well, it's possible that the property will still be available when you amass the necessary funds.
Yes. It's a fine property. Well-watered, plentiful stands of timber, beautiful view.
Ah, excellent. The Jarl was hoping you would be interested.
Thank you! Let me know if you have anything you need from me. I'm at your service.
There's no house available, but I could sell you a fine piece of land where you could build your own house.
Follow the road east from Falkreath, then north at the crossroads. Turn left just past Pinewatch.
You won't regret it. Here's the title to your steading.
A fine steading like this needs a good steward. I'd be happy to take on that position, if you'd like.
Of course. I didn't mean to meddle in your private affairs.
I'm a married man! Hey, where should we live? I guess you could always stay with me.
Here's a letter from the Jarl's steward. Looks like official business.
You already have children, don't you? I'm sorry, but I can't let you adopt anyone else.
They... they're dead. My mama died when I was little. I... I don't remember her very well.
Why yes, yes of course! What a wonderful surprise!
Oh, but... you have children, don't you? We'll have to find somewhere with room for them.
Not much. But I hope you like them!
Bits and Pieces in Solitude is probably the place to start. They sell all sorts of things like that.
I'm sorry, no. Grelod is the headmistress here, and she's decided not to allow any adoptions right now.
What do you want to play?
I'm Hroar. You know, like the sound the lion makes? That's what my mother used to say.
I... I'll be all right. Please, just... just make it stop!
Ah, good. There's one I've had my eye on. I'll see if it's still for sale.
Papa said we could go fishing! With my help, I'm sure he'll catch something this time!
Just fine, love. The weather here is wonderful, perfect for playing outdoors.
My father is Alvor, the blacksmith. I'm his assistant. I mean, apprentice.
You're here to adopt someone? Really? Oh, wow!
Braith is a big meanie. She keeps telling Lars 'n me what to do. I don't wanna play with her anymore.
Fine, fine. Living out here on our own will take some getting used to, but I think it'll be good for us.
This place is scary. There are monsters in the swamp. I just know it!
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Falkreath. Congratulations.
Congratulations. I hope you have a wonderful life together.
I'm sorry, but you can't afford that right now.
What is it? What is it?
I need to be sure your child will have a safe, stable home to grow up in.
I got you a present, Mama! I hope you like it!
You got me a present? Really?
You'll need to build a pen for it first.
I'm all alone. I... I try to sell flowers so I can buy food. It's not much but... what else can I do?
Aww... come on. Just a few more minutes? Please?
I've been the only girl here since forever. The boys pick on me, and they make me do all the chores.
Look at all the snow! I want to go sledding! Or skating!
Are you really gonna adopt one of us?
I found something for you. It... sounds like things have been bad lately, so... I hope this cheers you up.
Pa said he'd take me hunting soon. I can't wait! I bet I'll bring down a mammoth!
Just... just let me get my things and say goodbye to everyone. I'll meet you at home. Thanks! Thanks again!
Is there anything else you need?
That big tree in the park looks so sad... I feel sorry for it.
A new home! Wow! I can't wait to see it!
Both my parents were in the Legion. There was... an ambush.
I grant you a personal Housecarl, and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
It's so c-c-cold here! If I play outside for too long, I'm going to freeze solid!
You probably want someone else. I'm just the stable boy.
The land is on the coast, across the Karth delta from Solitude. An inspiring location, as you'll see.
I think we may have a problem in the basement. Been hearing a lot of scurrying down there lately.
Just fine. Whiterun is a lovely city, and there are so many other children here- they all love playing together.
Yes. It's on the north coast of Hjaalmarch, with a magnificent view of Solitude on its crag. Just the place for a new manor house.
I hate Markarth. There's nowhere to play! It's all just rocks. Rocks rocks rocks.
There are lots of scary people here, Mama. Promise you'll keep me safe?
I hate it. Everyone feels sorry for me, so they don't treat me too bad, but...
Excellent. We're glad to have you as a landowner in Hjaalmarch. Here's the title to your steading.
Fine, just fine. This house is perfect for a growing family.
Very well, let's try this again...
You know Belethor's shop in Whiterun? That'd be a good place to start. He carries all sorts of things like that.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Sure! What do you want to play?
Did you really build this house all by yourself? Wow!
The Palace looks so pretty. I wish they'd let me inside...
I... I guess it would be all right if you want to adopt me. At least until my real parents get back.
You got me a present? Wow, thanks, Ma!
You have children, though, don't you? We'll have to find somewhere with room for them, too.
Someday I'll take over the mill... when I'm old enough.
Really? Do you... do you have a place I could live?
Lars is such a milk-drinker. He can't even stand up to a girl.
My papa died and... and I'm all alone...
I take care of the horses. And the goats. And the chickens. And the garden.
Well enough. Riften's a tough city, but... it's a tough world. Kid has to learn to stand up for themselves sometime.
My ma died, and... and I don't know what to do...
Do you think I could be a Bard? I really like singing.
Constance and the others are nice enough, but I... I want to have a real family.
Hmm. You might try Gray Pine Goods in Falkreath. They carry all sorts of things like that.
Hmph. This city's crawling with thieves. Cowards. Kid could learn some bad habits here.
This war has created so many orphans, and so few are willing to open their hearts to them...
Well, that's your business. Was there anything else you needed?
Sure thing, friend. I'll even have it delivered to your building site, no charge.
Fine, fine. This city's not safe, but... that's good. Keeps a kid on edge, alert. Could keep 'em alive when they grow up.
You tell me. Between the Forsworn and the mines, Markarth is no place to raise a child.
Good. This is a city that respects strength. Honors it. A good lesson for children to learn.
Certainly. I'll have it delivered to the chest near your workbenches.
I was just getting settled in. Where are we going?
Fine, fine. Plenty of kids here to play and spar with. Plenty of trades to learn. It's a good place to raise a child.
I want to be big and strong like a lion, too. Someday.
Very good, I'll make all the arrangements.
Very well, I'll make the arrangements. The next time you visit your house, your new furnishings will be in place.
Thanks... thanks for talking to me.
What do you do for a living?
Doing some building, eh? We can deliver it wherever you need.
I'll have them hauled over right away.
Couldn't be better. Whiterun is perfect for a child- great weather, plenty of space, friends to play with. What more could you want?
Look what I found! Here, take it!
I played with Lucia in the park today. I feel sorry for her.
That's all I need from you. Congratulations! I think you'll make an excellent parent.
I'm sorry, but until you own a home with a room for your children, I can't allow you to adopt anyone.
Show me that you can support a child. Buy a house. Furnish it. Then come back, and we'll talk.
Hmph. This city's crawling with filth. It's everything I can do keep the children safe.
This is the happiest day of my life. Where should we live? My home is your home now, of course.
Once you've made a decision, I'll collect their things and be sure they make it over to your house.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Certainly. What did you have in mind?
As well as can be expected. Dear, this house would work for the two of us, but with children? We need to find a bigger place.
Talk to Geimund if you want a horse, or Katla if you're looking for work. I can't help you.
Sure thing, friend. I can use a break anyway.
I... I wish things were otherwise. All of these children deserve a better home. But there's nothing I can do.
Could you give me an allowance?
First, I'll need to ask you a few questions.
It's too bad the orphanage ain't letting us kids get adopted. I'd be the best son ever.
I think you'll want a stable before we spend good coin on a horse.
I'd be honored to be your steward. You've built a fine steading here.
I can't believe Grelod is dead. I had no love for the woman, but to be murdered, in cold blood...
I wound up here, but... I... I don't know what to do. I miss her so much...
Look, don't waste my time. Come back when you're ready to discuss this for real.
Really? Are you... are you sure?
Of course. What room would you like me to furnish?
The Argonians at the docks say they can breathe underwater. I wish I could do that...
Yes, of course! That's wonderful news!
I got you a present, Ma! I hope you like it!
My... my parents died, and... and now I'm all alone...
Well, love, very well. There's so much history in this city, so many things we can do here.
I got you a present, Papa! I hope you like it!
Mama took me to the market! There were lot of pies and cakes there. She said she'd show me how to bake one!
Papa! We're playing a game. Do you want to play?
Go on, speak to the children! I'm sure they're eager to meet you.
I'm gonna join the Stormcloaks. They're the best!
I need to get my things and say goodbye to everyone. I'll meet you at home. Thanks! Thanks so much!
Congratulations! If you ever want to adopt another child, you'll always be welcome here.
Mama died, and now I'm... I'm all alone...
Oh, wow! Are you... are you sure? You really wouldn't mind?
Grimvar said a boy used to live in that abandoned house, all alone, 'til the Dark Brotherhood came 'n got him. Scary, huh?
Don't pay much, but they let me sleep by the fire in the inn most nights.
My father was a Stormcloak soldier. One day, he left and... didn't come back.
What? What kind of a joke is this?
Ma took me to the market. We saw this huge fish! I bet even you couldn't lift it!
You want to adopt one of us, right? I'm strong, I'm fast, I'm smart, I can do anything better than them. Come on, pick me? Please?
Hi Mister! Would you like to buy some flowers? Please?
Lady, could you spare a coin?
You came to visit! It's so much better here with Grelod gone. Thanks to you.
Maramal said I could visit the temple whenever I wanted.
I climbed all the way up to the temple, but they said I wasn't old enough to get in. They're just mean.
There aren't any houses for sale in Morthal. But if you're interested, I could sell you land in the hold where you could build your own house.
Yes, it is. The Jarl thought of you when it came up for sale.
Fine, love. I think the fresh air does wonders for all of us, and this house... it's just perfect.
Very well, love. This is a beautiful house, and Solitude is so safe, so diverse. It's a wonderful place to raise a child.
I guess we have our entire lives together, now. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
Yea! Thanks, Mama! I promise, I'll be the best daughter ever!
Mister Brynjolf gave me an apple, Papa! He seems nice.
Aicantar let me see his museum. It's really nice.
Very good. I'll see about hiring a carriage driver at once.
Fine, when we're not fending off attacks by wolves. Or bears. Or giant spiders. Honestly, what were you thinking, sending us out here?
If you don't mind getting your feet wet, your best bet is to head north past the mill. The odd tomb or two along the way won't bother you.
Great. There's so much history here in Windhelm, so much to learn about our ancestors and our land.
Dragonsreach is so cool! All the kids there are mean, though.
Mama! We're playing a game. Do you want to play?
Hey, Pa, I got you something! I hope you like it!
My mother and father brought me here a year ago. They said they'd be back soon, but... they're awfully late.
Please, won't you buy a flower?
When I grow up, I wanna join the Legion!
You got me a present? Wow, thanks, Pa!
I saw a Thalmor the other day. He was really scary!
My... my parents died, not too long ago. I... I don't know what to do...
I went fishing at the lake. I almost caught something!
Oh, fine. So many guards on the street here I hardly have to worry.
But you have kids, right? We should find a home where we can live together.
I know we don't have much money, but I... I wanted to get you something. It's not much, but...
My pa was a sailor. Took me with him on his last trip. After he got sick, they... put us off here and left without us.
It's... it's what Brenuin said I should do. He's the only one that's been nice to me since... since mama...
Hey, Ma! Want to play a game with us?
Mister Brynjolf said he could teach me a lot of neat things when I'm older.
Banning said I could come play with his dogs. I want a dog.
But it's not even dark yet!
Honestly, I'm a little worried. Markarth is nice enough, but... I wonder if it's really safe for children.
Wha? But.... but it's dark out. Is it... really okay?
Oh really? And where were you thinking?
Wow! I can't wait to see my new home!
All right, I'll see you there!
Make it stop! Please, make it stop!
Name's Samuel. Never met my parents. Grelod said my mother worked here at the Orphanage, but she died when I was born.
Could I get a few gold to spend? Please?
We face the world together now. Where should we live? My home is yours.
Hey, Pa! You want to play a game with us?
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Hjaalmarch. Congratulations.
I'm sorry, but the children aren't up for adoption right now. You should go.
Rolff says I shouldn't go to the Grey Quarter anymore. He said it's not safe there.
I'll keep an eye out for a good cow to purchase.
Hey, Ma! Want to play a game with us?
Better than ever. Nothing like living off the land to teach you how to fight, how to survive. We'll have a little warrior on our hands in no time.
I like living here. The lake is so pretty.
What... what am I going to do?
Meh. Children get soft when they're coddled in a place like this.
We're married. I guess we'll need to decide where we're living, won't we? You can always stay with me.
I wanna go swimming, but the guards keep yelling at me. The canal's not that dirty...
I guess it could be worse. But... I'm sick of sleeping outside with the horses. I want a real home, real parents. Not... this.
Wow, really? What'd you get me?
I'm running food and supplies to the miners.
So I like to have a little fun, so what?
I'll see to it at once.
Hey, Pa! You want to play a game with us?
Some pretty flowers. I picked them all by myself!
...since she died. My aunt and uncle took over our farm and threw me out. Said I wasn't good for anything.
Pick one of the others. I'll be fine.
Katla said she'd feed me if I could make myself useful. I take care of the animals, run errands, that kind of thing.
Wha... seriously? No way... With this, I... I could buy everything in the market! Wow! Thanks!
Hi Lady! Would you like to buy some flowers? Please?
I like it here. The tree in the park is so pretty!
I grant you a personal Housecarl, and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I can't just give away good timber.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
Did you get me a present?
Mister, could you spare a coin?
We should find a place with room for your kids, though.
There's a new lady in charge of the Orphanage in Riften. She asked me to hand out these notices to everyone I met.
Go meet the children and decide who you'd like to adopt.
Hey, I got you something. Hope you like it!
When you've actually got the coin, we can do business.
My pa died, and... and now I'm all alone.
Ah. Unfortunately, I'm afraid you're a bit short of funds at the moment.
No one bought any flowers again today. I... I don't know what to do.
What? If you aren't going to be...
He... died a few days later. I've tried to make do since then, but... it's been hard. Real hard.
Yea! Thanks, mister- um, Papa! I promise, I'll be the best daughter ever!
...wait. Shor, you're serious! Well, I... all right then.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of the Pale. Congratulations.
...Look, let's be realistic. You're an adventurer. It's not exactly a safe or reliable profession.
I grant you a personal Housecarl, and this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
Of course. What are we running short of?
Where will your child be living?
Oh, fine, if you want to bring up little pickpockets. This place is a terrible influence on a child.
Why... why did you do that?
I will remain on guard here.
Is... is that your pet? Really? Wow, he looks tough!
Hmph. Suit yourself. I can't promise someone else won't buy it in the meantime, though.
As you command, Thane. I'll wait at the White Hall in Dawnstar until you need me again.
My parents dropped me off here a year ago. But they're coming back to get me. They said so.
I... I know it's not much, but... I've found a few little things. I've put them in the chest in my room.
It's in the south of the Pale, near Giants' Gap. Just the spot for someone like you to establish a steading.
I... I have a home again. A family. I almost can't believe it.
This is more than I ever could have hoped for. Thanks. Thanks so much.
I have a family again. I... I can't thank you enough.
I'd... I'd really like a dolly. Or maybe a pretty new dress?
It's a fine property. Well-watered, plentiful stands of timber, beautiful view.
Well, sweets are always good. Or a new outfit. Or... or maybe a wooden sword? All my friends have swords.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go and take care of it.
Is it time to move out?
It's on the north coast of Hjaalmarch, with a magnificent view of Solitude on its crag. Just the place for a new manor house.
I'll never speak to you again!
Yes, my Thane? Do you need something?
A doggy! Papa, I didn't know you had a doggy! He's so cute...
This is... this is great! It's everything I could have asked for!
Ah, everybody around here's so serious.
Could I... could I keep him? Please?
Are you... are you going to adopt one of us?
A dog! Wow, I didn't know you had a dog!
My blade is yours to command, Thane.
Well, you smell like a Hagraven. And you look like one, too!
I hereby grant you permission to purchase property in Falkreath hold. Talk to my steward if you're interested.
Ah, it's you. Yes, well, now we'll see if the stories about you are true.
Look, Papa! I made a new friend!
A pet! Wow, I didn't know you had a pet!
I'll keep watch at Lakeview Manor until you return, Thane. Good hunting.
How can I serve you, my Thane?
Well... I heard there's a really nice tailor's in Solitude. And... and maybe the Khajiit sell dolls? They always have the best toys.
I do hope mummy and father come to get me soon. Ever since that Aventus boy left, this place has gone mad.
Look, Mama! I have a new friend!
For clothes... there's a tailor's shop in Solitude. I'm sure they'd have lots to choose from.
Okay! You stand right there and count to 10... no peeking! Ready? ...Go!
There's a group of bandits in my Hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
I'll return to Highmoon Hall in Morthal until you need me again, Thane.
I'll return to Windstad Manor and remain on guard, my Thane.
It's... it's everything I could have hoped for.
Ah, a letter from the Jarl! Moving up in the world, eh?
By the gods, a dragon's been sighted just south of the city, flying around Lost Tongue Overlook.
You know what? I like you. You're not afraid to get your hands dirty.
Hello friend. Make yourself at home.
Wonderful. I'll sleep better knowing you're watching the southern marches. Here's the title to your steading.
If you see anything you want, take it. You've done so much for me... it's the least I can do.
You have quite a house. I'm thinking of setting up a small store here. Sell odds and ends.
I... I know it's not much, but... I've found a few pretty things. They're in the chest in my room.
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go and take care of it.
You came to visit! It's so much better here with Grelod gone. Thanks to you.
Just follow the road south from Dawnstar, past Fort Dunstad, then head south.
Yes, it is. It's in the southern part of the Pale, right on the border with Whiterun Hold. All the room in the world to build your own house.
Sorry, no houses for sale in Dawnstar right now. But... I could sell you land in the hold where you could build your own house.
Land? Ah, yes. The Heljarchen estate. I thought of you immediately when it became available.
That's unfortunate. Maybe I misjudged you.
Do you... do you think I could keep him for you?
Ma! Look what followed me home!
All right. I do worry, though, no matter how many times the guards say Markarth is safe.
As you command, Thane. I'll guard Heljarchen House until you return.
Is... is that your pet, Papa? He looks really scary!
Don't be long. My place is by your side.
Oh yeah? Well, I've seen mudcrabs that're smarter than you!
Pa! Look what followed me home!
I'm sure the Khajiit would have one- their toys are the best!
Oh. For some reason I didn't realize you were the same person all the stories were about...
I'll wait for you at the Jarl's Longhouse in Falkreath until you need me again, Thane.
Constance takes good care of us. But... I still want a real home. A real family.
It's not too bad here. But... I still miss my parents.
I hate it here. I... I wanna go home.
A real home. A real family. I almost can't believe it.
Is... is that your pet, Mama? He looks really scary!
There's that group of bandits that need to be taught a lesson, remember?
Of course, Thane. How can I be of service?
Do you need something from me, Thane? Or can I carry something for you?
Lead on, Thane. My blade is always yours to command.
A doggy! Mama, I didn't know you had a doggy! He's so cute...
Why's someone like you want to hang around a place like this?
Do you... do you think I could keep him?
Well, in any case, you still need to kill those bandits, remember? Then we can discuss you buying property in Falkreath.
I'm yours to command, Thane. I'll wait here until you need me.
I'm eleven years old, and I could take you.
Good. My place is by your side, Thane.
The land is near Giants' Gap, right on the border with Whiterun Hold. You'll almost be in sight of the Loreius Farm, in fact.
If you see anything you like, please, take it! You've done so much for me. It's... it's the least I can do.
Married. It doesn't feel like I thought it would, but I'm happy. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
Ah, excellent! We'll just call this a misunderstanding between friends. I've already forgotten it, myself.
I think you're looking for the chief.
You'd better be on your way now.
You're stupid. All we wanted was money! They're gonna cut her throat now!
You look like the type who'd rather let your girlfriend die than fork over some gold. And people think we're heartless monsters...
I'm glad to see you! Let's get out of here!
Hello, my name is Oriella, the bard that you asked your steward to hire. I hope my music will be pleasing to you.
I knew you'd come for me!
I knew you'd come for me!
Hold on. We didn't know it was you we were messing with. Look, we'll let him go and call it even, all right? No need for any more trouble.
It would be pleasant to have some music in the house. I'll make inquiries about retaining the services of a bard.
You gotta talk to the chief. Rochelle.
Don't worry, she's on her way. Just be patient for a minute.
Grr... I'm gonna get you for that!
Well if you don't have any money, what are we standing here talking about?
Good! I knew you couldn't have been serious when you dismissed me. Life without music is hardly worth living, is it?
The chief wanted me to tell you... your girlfriend was real nice to us while you were gone.
Certainly. I am trained in the three traditional bardic instruments: lute, drum, and flute. Which would you prefer?
As you wish. We can consider this incident nothing more than an unfortunate misunderstanding.
Oh. Well then, I'd best be on my way.
Well if you don't have any money, what are we standing here talking about?
Good day to you. I am Sonir, the bard that your steward has hired. Please let me know if there's anything specific you want to hear.
Allow me to introduce myself. I am the bard Llewellyn, known as "The Nightingale". Your steward has arranged for me to take service with you.
Stupid Lars Battle-Born. I fight him almost every day, but it's not much of a fight, 'cause he don't fight back.
You're stupid. All we wanted was money! They're gonna cut his throat now!
Your wish is my command, as always.
Well if you don't have any money, what are we standing here talking about?
Hold on. We didn't know it was you we were messing with. Look, we'll let her go and call it even, all right? No need for any more trouble.
Have it your way. It isn't worth it. There are easier ways to make money.
I'm sorry to hear that. It was my honor to have you as a patron. Please let your steward know if you want to hire me again.
I think there's something in the basement. I'm afraid to go down there.
You're a connoisseur, indeed. Not many appreciate the subtle beauty of the flute.
You won't enter this house while I live!
Don't worry, we're not monsters. She's fine. We get the money, you get the girl. Everybody wins, right?
You don't get a second chance with me.
I'll try to hold them off!
You look like the type who'd rather let your boyfriend die than fork over some gold. And people think we're heartless monsters...
Yes? Did you change your mind?
Sit back and enjoy some classical drumming.
Relax, hero... he's fine. At least he was. The chief liked him so much, she took him back home. Here's a letter for you.
Relax, hero. She's fine. At least she was. The chief liked her so much, she took her back home. Here's a letter for you.
I can't wait to get back home.
You don't want to be bothering me.
Don't worry, we're not monsters. He's fine. We get the money, you get the guy. Everybody wins, right?
Don't worry, he's on his way. Just be patient for a minute.
Maybe you want to read this first.
The most elegant of instruments. The pinnacle of the bardic art.
The chief wanted me to tell you... your boyfriend was real nice to us while you were gone.
Could you take a look in the basement? I've been hearing strange noises down there lately.
Is that how you want to play it, huh? That's fine with me.
I just want to get out of here!
Well, well. You're a lot smarter than I expected. I hope you brought the gold.
Really? You mean it? Wow, thanks, Pa! I promise, I won't be any trouble at all!
Really? You mean it? Wow, thanks, Ma! I promise, I won't be any trouble at all!
No, I'm sorry. But there is land, available to you for purchase.
Oh yes, of course. It's available to you for purchase.
Hm. Well, if you change your mind, come see me again.
Then by my right as Jarl, I grant you a title to the land.
Of course. It's available, if you want to buy it.
Let me know if you change your mind.
Excellent. Then I grant you a title to the land.
No, I'm afraid not. But there is land if you want to buy it.
Hey! I know. The Jarl's wizard could teach ya. He's lots closer.
If that's what you want. I'll see you there, soon.
The two of us, living together. I'll see you at home!
I can't believe my mother's gone. Now what'll I do?
I'm really afraid of Grelod. When Aventus escaped, she was so mad. I got double the beatings that day.
You'd better give me five septims right now, or I'm going to bloody your nose...
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Hjaalmarch. Congratulations.
You really shouldn't be in here.
Five, four, three, two, one... go!
Papa may have wanted a son, but he got me. He's a lucky man.
Father says I don't have the knack for reading, but mama says I won't need it to work the farm.
I guess we have our entire lives together, now. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
My papa says I'm greg-gare-ree-yus, just like him! He says it means "smart," but my brother says he's wrong.
When I grow up, I'm going to be an assassin. That way I can help lots of children, just like you.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
What're you lookin' at? I'm not afraid of you, ya know. Even if you are my elder.
If you can get Braith to leave me alone, I'll be your best friend... forever! I'll pay you, too! My whole life's savings - two septims!
My mother taught me the millwork trade... you know, which trees to cut and which ones to pass up.
Hiya! What's your name? Are you visiting? What do you do?
This is the happiest day of my life. Where should we live? My home is your home now, of course.
It's a wonderful house, my love. If you don't mind, I'm going to start a small store. Something to do whenever you're on the road.
Mom says the Empire is mean, but I don't think they're that bad.
This is the Old Hroldan Inn. Clean beds and strong drink.
A good house. You chose well. I don't like sitting still, so I've decided to open a store. Buy and sell whatever is needed.
Some day I'm going to forge my own sword!
I've seen bigger houses, but it's yours, so I like it. Now, I think I need something to do if you're ever away, so I'll be opening a store.
Most days, I do all I can to stay away from my sister and my father. The beating's the same from either one.
I know all the good spots! You don't stand a chance!
I hope you're not here to start some trouble. I'll fight you if I have to.
Papa says I won't see Roggvir any more, but he wouldn't tell me why not.
Whoa! They killed Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
We're married. I guess we'll need to decide where we're living, won't we? You can always stay with me.
Some day soon I'll stop being afraid. Jouane is teaching me magic. He says I'm real good.
Married. It doesn't feel like I thought it would, but I'm happy. Where should we live? You could stay with me....
I hate it here. Grelod the Kind is the meanest person in all of Skyrim.
Derkeethus used to take me diving way down deep in the river. I miss him.
Sondas takes care of me when mom's not around.
For a stranger, you're not so bad.
Sissel thinks she's so special. No way she's more special than me.
Papa used to say I was greg-gare-ree-yus, just like him. I miss him...
Millwork sure is boring, but at least I don't have to work in a nasty mine.
Why do they call it Left Hand Mine? Can the miners use their right hands too?
We face the world together now. Where should we live? My home is yours.
I... I don't have any money.
I do hope mummy and father come to get me soon. Ever since that Aventus boy left, Grelod has been so angry.
It will be our little nest. I'll be waiting for you there.
When Aventus escaped, Grelod was so mad. I got double the beatings that day. But that won't happen ever again.
Grelod... murdered. Here. I... I need... air... You... you... Get out of here! Get out!
Figures. You elders are always so boring.
I don't fight Lars no more, if that's what you're worried about.
Papa says I'm too friendly with strangers, but you seem all right.
We're united, but where should we live? My home is yours, of course.
I... I don't want to talk.
Aren't you a sight for sore eyes.
Hi! I've never seen you around here before. Are you a miner too?
Someday I'm going to kill a dragon all by myself.
I'll be waiting for you at home, then.
I'll see you at home, then. Don't keep me waiting!
A home for the two of us. I'll meet you there.
Our new home. I'll see you there!
All right. I'll see you there.
Changed the linens myself. They're fresh.
I'm not afraid of anyone. Put a sword in my hand and I could defend this place if I had to!
I used to hate it here, but it's not so bad anymore. Constance is real good to us.
Pa says I'm too young to fight in the war, but I can still help by patrolling the town.
Have you met Lucky? He's my pet goat, and he helps me patrol the town.
Papa doesn't like when I talk to customers, anyway.
Come back if you want to play tag.
Here. You deserve a reward for your service.
You stand right there and count to 10. No peeking. Ready? Okay go!
Five, four, three, two, one... go!
I'm strong, and quick, and can do any chore you want. Come on, adopt me. Please?
You gotta have better things to do than talk to me all day...
I was named after the sound a lion makes. You know: rrroooaaaarr! Really.
Magic? That's dangerous. You want to learn that, go to that College in Winterhold. They teach that stuff there.
If there's nothing else, I really must ask you to leave.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
I'll also notify my guards of your new title. Wouldn't want them to think you're part of the common rabble, now.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of the Pale. Congratulations.
I grant you this weapon from my armory to serve as your badge of office.
Then by my right as Jarl, I name you Thane of Falkreath. Congratulations.
Grelod ain't going to like some stranger just hangin' around. Not that I care.
If you drink too much, you're out. No drunks.
Don't have to tell me twice. But then, I'm not the one that buried iron under these mountains.
Please, mister. You got to get me out of here. Ever since Aventus left, Grelod's been even meaner than usual. I swear, she's going to kill one of us.
Have you met Torom? He's the best dog in the Reach.
Ten septims tomorrow, baby Battle-Born. Or I'm gonna bloody your nose and your lip.
You're a guest. And father says we have to be polite to guests.
This house is huge. I'll be tripping my feet all over this place. Hey, I think I'll start a little business here. Something to do, you know?
Yes. Braith bullies me all the time. All the elders think I'm a milk drinker 'cause I can't fight. Nobody understands.
Ain't nothin' a boy can do that I can't do better.
No! Please! I really don't have any money, Braith! I'll give you ten septims tomorrow. Just don't hit me.
Assur and I are playing a game. Don't tell him where I am!
I wish I could be an adventurer like you, and go wherever I want.
Come to get yourself a kid? You're out of luck. No way Grelod will let any of us get adopted. Especially not since Aventus took off.
Watch your tongue, stranger. We don't take backtalk in this inn.
Kill one person, and you can solve so many problems. I wonder at the possibilities.
Mother wants me to work at the mill. But I ain't nobody's slave.
Hey. You wanna play a game?
It's just me and my mother at the mill here. My father is gone. We don't know what happened to him.
I wish I was a soldier! They get to travel and stay up late and have fun!
Teach them to stop paying me.
Boys, girls, dogs, elders - there's nobody I won't fight!
Hope Pavo will be able to go back to his mine soon. Everyone needs a home.
Are you a soldier? One day, I'm going to be a soldier!
Then I'll see you at home!
You've proven reliable. There's a group of bandits in my Hold that I... may have had a few discreet dealings with.
Get me mad, and I'll prank ya. And not a little. A lot.
Assur always wants to play "Hunt the Elf" and he makes me be the Elf.
I am sworn to carry your burdens.
Very well. I'll meet you there.
I will be back at your house if you need me, Thane.
I knew it! I knew my father was a hero and he didn't just run away.
There's a new museum opening up in Dawnstar. The owner is asking me to hand out invitations to travelers.
The Stormcloaks are named after Ulfric. He's a bad man, but don't tell the soldiers that.
Mother says I shouldn't talk to people...
My only concern is for the children. The poor darlings have no one else.
I trust you're not planning any trouble. What can I do for you, friend?
The cut they were giving me was good at first, but now it's time to clean things up. Go and take care of it.
This house of yours is wondrous, at least to these eyes. I've thought about starting a store. Something to do here when you're out.
I'll get everything ready and meet you there.
You look kind of scary. But nobody is scarier than old Grelod.
Good to see you. Come on in.
Papa says I'm not ready for weapons. So I make lots of horseshoes and hobnails.
You're new around here, so I'll go easy on ya. But don't get on my bad side.
My friend Dorthe doesn't like my pranking. "You're being mean, Frodnar!" So what if I am?
There's not many people left in Winterhold, so I only have Assur to play with, and sometimes he's mean.
When Aventus took off, when he said those things, about killing Grelod... I never imagined he was serious...
Finally. I got stuff to do, ya know.
Strange house, but strong. Solid. I think I'll open a store. A task to tend to whenever you're away.
I'm the older sister, by nearly five minutes. Sissel's barely worthy to walk in my shadow.
Why is everyone so upset? If there's Forsworn, the Jarl will take care of them, right?
Things are much better now that Grelod is dead, but still. I'm sick of this place.
I don't have anything to say.
My mother's dead, but I won't close the inn. I've hired Leontius to run things.
Constance don't care much for strangers in the orphanage. Afraid someone might hurt one of us kids. Which, I gotta admit, is kind of nice.
Please, lady. You got to get me out of here. Ever since Aventus left, Grelod's been even meaner than usual. I swear, she's going to kill one of us.
Are you new around here? You should go to the inn if you need a place to stay.
Mama doesn't think I'm girlish enough. But that's just stupid girl talk.
Assur says his pa says the College made lots of bad things happen, but the mages I've seen look nice.
Assur had to move away because of the Empire. But we get to stay.
Constance Michel says we have to be careful of people we don't know.
The mages don't let us go in the College. They said it's not safe in there.
I can't believe it! Grelod is dead! She's really dead!
Mama said I could help with the goats!
What'cha doing in Left Hand? Do you dig up rocks too, like my mom?
If you beat up my sister Sissel, I won't tell.
I had a dream that there was a good dragon. He was old and gray, but he wasn't scary.
As you will, my Thane. I will protect you with my life.
I'll be right here. Be careful now!
